website_summaries.verdict: A basic remote car started with lots of features for its value price.
pros: A value-priced remote car starter that has similar features as more costly models
cons: While some users might find that the small remotes are convenient to carry, we find them easy to misplace

customer_reviews.title: So i got this thing a couple of weeks before ...
customer_reviews.text: So i got this thing a couple of weeks before Christmas and naturally i didn't even look at the thing until the end of January due to Christmas,Work Weather etc. This thing is not meant for even the competent user,most mortals would need it installed.It is the most unfriendly set up I've come across and I've put half a dozen of these(various manufacturers) in over the years(oh and the remotes are recklessly flimsy) Unless you have what i think would be a full day,possibly two for the competent amateur or the best part of a day for the more seasoned then just skip it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was quite easy when paired with the. On my specific vehicle, I only had to connect the 5 starter wires, horn wire, parking light wire, and a ground. The rest of the functions were handled through CAN-BUS by the DBALL2 module. No fishing through doors to get to lock and trunk wires! This system even senses when the vehicle has started without using a tach wire. *The functions are vehicle-dependent, YMMV. Programming using the valet/programming button is fairly easy after a few minutes of practice. While I'm familiar with car electronic installation, this was my first remote-start application. I had the system installed and running in under 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I am a mechanic not an alarm ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it . I am a mechanic not an alarm installer . The instructions suck suck suck .i have previously Installed compustar alarm that was more difficult to install but had much better instructions . Keep in mind u need to have previous electrical experience . And once installed into my fathers in-laws 02 silverado it required a key bypass module and relays to switch the lock polarity to positive and an additional relay for ign2 .But it functions flawlessly and has at least a few hundred feet range. It's great jumping into a warm truck on a cold day and vice versa
customer_reviews.author: Chashawna

customer_reviews.title: good product, not for the casual diy
customer_reviews.text: The remote works like it is supposed to. I installed this on my wife's Accord. I had to buy a pkall security bypass module, which connects to the 4103 with the supplied D2D cable. Only a professional auto electronics technician should really go cutting amd splicing wires for the security data lines and ignition wiring; therefore the installation instructions are written for pro installers. It is a little unfurtunate that Directed offers little support. However, the car manufacturers do the same thing if yoi have a tech question about the car.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Mcnary

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Difficult install with basically no directions supplied. Worked great for my 2004 toyota echo since it has zero power options and no chip in the key. The smart tach feature refused to work I had to use the voltage sense option for the car to start. Distance is the same as a factory starter. Worth paying someone to install in my opinion I wouldn't do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The range on the remote is pretty great. I can be standing in line at ...
customer_reviews.text: The range on the remote is pretty great. I can be standing in line at the supermarket and start my car that is parked in the middle of the lot. The buttons are a little on the sensitive side, which means that sometimes I accidentally start my car at home when I bend down and my keys get squished I'm my jeans, but this is fairly rare.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Works great. No problems to speak of really
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No problems to speak of really. It was a bear to install though. Not a DIY install unless you are real comfortable with splicing into your factory wiring and can read wiring diagrams well. Bulldog security makes some T-type connectors that will work with certain vehicles so that you don't have to cut into your factory wiring. I am not sure what they cost, but I would say that would make a DIY install easier if they have them for your vehicle. Great price though! Much cheaper than anywhere local, that is for sure! Had it on my car for several years now and it still works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Perry

customer_reviews.title: This is a good entry level remote starter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good entry level remote starter. The remotes have very good range if you have line of sight. Through windows/concrete not so much. I deducted 1 start because BOTH remotes have broken the little plastic at the bottom where the key ring goes. I was lucky that both fell off right in front of me...but that plastic is not up to snuff for repeated in/out of pockets on a keychain.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: good product, poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are absolute garbage, and this is much more complicated than installing a car stereo. Works well though, and is very affordable. I am only using it for keyless entry though. E-mailed Avital a question and never heard back. Just did some testing with a multi-meter and the unit hooked to a 12V battery. Was able to figure it out OK. There is a much more thorough installation guide available online.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my starter!!! Having the luxury of getting into a toasty warm vehicle when it's freezing below outside here in WI is awesome! The installer informed me this was one of the best (found out Avital was one of the only two brands he supplied in the shop), it's starting range is at least 50', it automatically lock the doors once started, and will instantly shut off the vehicle if you try to drive off without the key in the ignition or Fob nearby (just by slightly tapping the brake). Buy it!! You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hurtx3

customer_reviews.title: Avital is the goods.
customer_reviews.text: Avital is the Bomb. Nice kit, love the pit-stop feature and the range is pretty good for the price. I hooked this bad boy up myself in my 1998 Chevy Lumina. I had to use some auto relays for the door locks and the VATS security bypass. Check your cars wiring diagram for the proper wires and their colors online. Don't bother hooking up the hood pin switch and the neutral gear selector can be grounded with no ill effects. Make the neighbors jealous of your remote start equipped car this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Lewk

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Remote Start System
customer_reviews.text: MUST get wiring diagram for YOUR make and model BEFORE you start. NOT recommended for a novice to attempt to install. It's OK to admit that it might be better for a Pro to install. Better than towing your car to best buy because you did something wrong... OK love this thing, I'm between novice and pro. no problems on install. and works like a dream. Everything i wanted and more. I've even added the remote trunk to mine, only had cable before. Boys and their toys lol
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit
customer_reviews.text: I may be an oddball here, but I installed this system myself. Do not attempt this if you do not have hours of time. It took me ~5 hours to wire it up. The system has a lot of features to it. Alarm system, keyless entry, remote start, turns on running lights, panic mode, valet mode, and it also turns on accessories. Not all of the wires you get will you use. I didn't use quite a few. Overall I think I'm going to like this unit. But gosh it is a pain to install. I'm just a cheap 16 year old who couldn't afford an installer though😂
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Generally works best with LOS to the car
customer_reviews.text: No frills. The range is similar to a cordless phone/TV remote. Generally works best with LOS to the car. Have to be in about a 30-50 foot range to use it. When I first got this the range would work across a wal mart parking lot for example but it has dropped significantly. This may be an issue with my car or something else, i did get a replacement 4103LX and it had the same results with range. I replaced it to troubleshoot an issue with my car sometimes starting and sometimes not starting
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My Go-To Remote
customer_reviews.text: Not for amateur installations, but if you are savvy with automotive electrical systems this is the unit to buy. Once it's installed and set up, expect many years of trouble free use.
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: This product is terrible, it does not start the car engine
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible, it does not start the car engine . This is a waste of time. After having to pay the guy to install it, it did not do what it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzy1234

customer_reviews.title: Installed beautifully on my 2004 toyota camry Le
customer_reviews.text: Installed beautifully on my 2004 toyota camry Le. I took it to a shop. They hooked the entire thing up and every button works as expected. A hell of a lot cheaper then going to Best Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: great quality kit
customer_reviews.text: great quality kit, only drawback to the kit was it is sold as an professional installer package which is fine if you have electronics background in automotive, installed on 97 jeep wrangler with automatic transmission. worked great and had no issues. would recommend but some signals that are needed might be tough for some to locate if your not in the business.
customer_reviews.author: JAMIE PEAL

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money. Does everything I need it to.
customer_reviews.text: Product is amazing for the price. The wiring diagram they provide can be a little tricky to understand. But there's plenty of free sites available for info. I installed this on a 97 Camry LE w/ 3.0 which has no real security modules. It took about 2 hours only because of experience as well as being exhausted. I'll be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Had to take it to a shop to put in just because my boyfriend didn’t want to deal with all the different wires! Once we did it though he loved the product! He was sad when he had to sell his truck with it in. So, this might be another Christmas present for his new truck!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap remote start meant for experienced installer or someone willing to put some time into researching it
customer_reviews.text: This product worked very well on my 2003 Pontiac vibe. This remote start has many options and there or no exact instructions for you to install it on your specific vehicle. It works really well, but It is not for the inexperienced to install. If you are comfortable with finding and reading wiring diagrams you can do it. I find the range to be great for starting the car in the drive way. I have not tried to find the max range. I have ordered another for my Miata.
customer_reviews.author: xxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: to dificult for an adverage D Y I guy to install and cost too much to have it installed by auto tech
customer_reviews.text: I bought this prod because It was affordable and I would like a remote start system for my car and I thought I could do the Installation this product should not be sold to just any one with the money It does a lot of stuff and I'm sure it is a great company until you have to use the website to get installation instructions. thats is when I secided I do not ne to start my car from my house I'll go outside and get cold or wet.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Baker

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: We could not find anyone who would install this product into our car. The installers do not want the liability of a product that is not theirs. You can try to install yourself, but if done incorrectly, may compromise your car's warranty. I do not recommend this product. Spend the extra money and get a professional.
customer_reviews.author: James McGillian

customer_reviews.title: works when it wants too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and took it to a professional place to install. it worked for a month , then after that, it works when it wants too. i took it back to the shop and they said this particular model has been known to do this. If I can get my money back i would do so.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Flavius

customer_reviews.title: Super remote start system!
customer_reviews.text: Love this remote. The instructions are minimal, but you can find wiring help by Googling. The range is exceptional. I remote started my car from the other side of a lake, in a park near my home. It has more features than noted by the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Player

customer_reviews.title: Would love to return it as it's not even been out ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with hopes of someone installing it but I wasn't able to find anyone that wouldn't charge absurd rates. Would love to return it as it's not even been out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Well made .
customer_reviews.text: Works great, would be nice if they told you the other items you need to install. Relays and resisters.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie E

customer_reviews.title: Great unit! Perfect for entry level remote start!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect entry-level remote start at a great price. I used to install professionally and would STRONGLY encourage a professional or experienced technican to install this or any other remote-start/alarm. There are so many small things that could go wrong if not installed properly. Does not work (legally) on manual transmissions. May need additional parts (ie. transponder key bypass or relay packs depending on the type of vehicle). Tech tips are available on the web, but the manufacturer WILL NOT provide wiring diagrams (due to the liability issues). It is possible to find them online. Always test wires first!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin R.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Better to buy the alarm and remote starter in one. For a GM you need the seperate module and it's not for beginners. Remote is comfortable and looks close to oem.
customer_reviews.author: dm32

customer_reviews.title: This product is very hard to install and a lot of people will not do it
customer_reviews.text: I took this remote starter to a few shops and they all said it was too hard to program no one will install this brand of remote starter I suggest you discontinue this line of remote starters
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very, very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've been using this remote starter for the past couple of months and it's been working great. I walked a half mile down the road and started it and it was running when I got back. I also can start it well inside a store, maybe a hundred yards or so, but can easily start well inside a building or around multiple buildings. I am very impressed with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: taxreliever

customer_reviews.title: Functioning perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Has been functioning perfectly for months now. Very glad we bought this for our 2006 Chevy 3500 Van. We also did have installed by a professional.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Alternative to OEM
customer_reviews.text: Its not as durable as the original but it works. I love the auto rolling up and down of the passenger window which I did not have on the OEM, the only problem with it though is that it no longer automatically rolls up, and sometimes I can't get it to go up at all, it eventually works after several tries, but not the auto roll. Will have to see how long the entire switch lasts.
customer_reviews.author: D. Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Directed will not let you log onto there web site ...
customer_reviews.text: Directed will not let you log onto there web site for help, you have to be a dealer to do so
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Wrongs great
customer_reviews.text: My son had this remote start installed on his 2005 Ford Mustang. His happy with it. Can turn car on from inside house. Happy buyer.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Longest range of any remote start unit!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I've installed dozens of them. Instructions are clear and install is easy. If you don't have at least a basic understanding of automotive wiring and lack the ability to identify your vehicle's wiring, then don't attempt to install yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: new remote start
customer_reviews.text: We had a couple of tech issues and the help line was super, turns out we weren't following instructions.
customer_reviews.author: C VICTOR WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Great remote car starter...but you better know what your doing
customer_reviews.text: Works great. But you better have some electrical skills. I installed this myself, and I took my time doing it over 3 weeks. Since I had another car, it was no big deal. Other car alarm install places will charge you about $400 for this same unit, so learning how to do it yourself can be a real money saver.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B Carranza

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Install!!!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my 2000 Nissan Frontier. All I needed to do was tie into the two ignition wires, starter wire, accessory wire, are run the two power wires to battery (for added safety). Other wires included the hood pin switch, parking lights, and horn(took me a while to find this was on same wire set as the air bag connector so had to be careful), and grounds . I also needed a "Anti-Grind" relay and i used to accessory output to cut power to starter if the remote start had the vehicle running. As long as you can find the basic wires, have no factory alarm, and have no key transponder, it would be VERY easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Drawdy

customer_reviews.title: EASY install, good range
customer_reviews.text: EASY install, good range, however NO instruction manual is included. Make sure you can find a wiring diagram for your car and a wiring diagram for this before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Nehal M

customer_reviews.title: These work great the ones I had were completely wore out and ...
customer_reviews.text: These work great the ones I had were completely wore out and only worked half of the time. I got at a great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Must HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Enables me to enjoy a warm car in the extremely cold temperatures!
customer_reviews.author: G.P. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Arrived promptly. Comes with a quick reference page only ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Comes with a quick reference page only, but you can get more detailed instructions online. Only issue i had was getting the horn to work with it. Only time you really need the horn is when programming the unit but the horn pulses along with an LED on the unit. So programming wasn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Louie T.

customer_reviews.title: exactly as stated.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with it. Fast shipping, the quality is exact what is in the picture. This is exactly the same as the viper 4103 system. The only difference is the remotes. If you're going to diy you can use that to your reference. I highly recommend doing your homework on installing this before attempting this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The range is great and it fires the first time every time
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a Viper system. I had a buddy who used to be an installer put it in in about 45 minutes. The range is great and it fires the first time every time. I only wish it had come with the resistors for the door locks.
customer_reviews.author: DJCN Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: Get it installed by a professional and you will not have any issues. Had this installed on my Honda Pilot 2008 and never had an issue. It starts the suv without issue and after 15 mins will turn off the engine. Range is good - Good product and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Gupt

customer_reviews.title: Worka great with my 99 Laredo
customer_reviews.text: Worka great with my 99 Laredo! The starter button is a bit touchy but love it so much and was a great present from my husband. I love testing how far I really can go pressing it too.
customer_reviews.author: greenreddew

customer_reviews.title: worked with some modification
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine - but there is a problem with my particular unit. Anytime I put the key in and turn to run to do the takeover, the ACC and IGN positions on the ignition cause the starter to crank. I metered it and found that the unit is backfeeding the accessory wire into the starter wire. i've installed hundreds of these over the years and only in the past year have i started to see problems with DEI products. but whatever - what other options do you have? i used a relay to open the starter wire and all is well now but that shouldn't be required.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Henson

customer_reviews.title: Great unit!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, it's a shame that the manufacturer doesn't focus at least a little on providing at t least little support for the do-it-yourselfer. Installation is not for the faint of heart. I have considerable experience in auto acc installation and it took me a good while and lots of Internet research, but it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: SCRLAR

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find someone who can install it. It is designed to be installed by one of their people.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice A.

customer_reviews.title: I just installed this on a '07 Toyota Yaris. ...
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this on a '07 Toyota Yaris. The only wires used were the following: 9-pin black ground and white light flash output (opted not to use horn or trunk release) 3-pin unlock and lock 6-pin all wires (hard to reach ignition D8 connector) 4-pin none 5-pin neutral safety switch ground, tachometer input, and brake shutdown Those connections were enough to lock and unlock doors and remote start with learned tachometer. I missed the neutral safety switch on the first go around, but the Avital diagnostic blinked 7 times to let me know that ground was missing. Big sigh of relief to know it was not a faulty t-splice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garland

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy install if you can figure out all the wires ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple easy install if you can figure out all the wires needed. Key FOB is small and sleek. The remote system is of good quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: Lee C.

customer_reviews.title: Verry good !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in summer for cooling the interior of the car and in the winter for heating it. I reccomend from all my heart. Cornel
customer_reviews.author: Cornel D.

customer_reviews.title: Shame on Directed!
customer_reviews.text: Lacks instructions... you will have to test connections like crazy to figure out proper install... Better to pay for a kit with an install. Shame on Directed!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping and good product. Used this with the Dball2 Express kit
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and good product. Used this with the Dball2 Express kit, to install a complete remote start in wife's 03 Grand Cherokee. It's been a few years now and it still works great. I used the hatch release function to turn on and off the rear defrost by taking the hatch release wire and tapping it into the defrost button wire behind the dash, have to hold the hatch release for 5-10 seconds, but it works. And doing this your self with these products is much cheaper then having one installed.
customer_reviews.author: daniel r haller

customer_reviews.title: I felt horrible. The included installation pamphlet states "this must be ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for gifts. In the end the recipients had to pay over $300 for the installation. I felt horrible. The included installation pamphlet states "this must be installed by Car Toys." Car Toys kept the vehicle all day and wouldn't give an estimated time of completion. It's much cheaper and convenient to purchase elsewhere to include the installation so you know up front what to expect the final price to be.
customer_reviews.author: Gina M Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Great starter!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Was a little difficult to install for a first timer but worth all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: kinda scary.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 2 months. Then vehicle would randomly go into security mode and shut off when driving. Removed from vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: GMF

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to install once you find the instructions online. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. instruction came with it was not great. can download the manual from google website. I like this product better than others was the remote start system come with its own diagnosis. the remote will blink the number of times indicating why the system fail. would buy it again in future if need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, had everything t I needed
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Has everything needed to work in my 2007 Kia rio lx (manual locks and windows). I had best buy's geek squad install the remote start only and paid about $130 for installation. They do recomend u get a plastic hood switch because this one came with a metal one and those can rust pretty quick. Otherwise, this thing works great and I can't be happier to have it
customer_reviews.author: sean gogerty

customer_reviews.title: Love this system
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. works great. So nice to get into a warm car without having to go outside to start it first. Love this.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this set up for all of my past vehicles. Great quality, reliable and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Elzani

customer_reviews.title: love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I received this quickly. My husband (the mechanic) installed it quickly in my 2001 Toyota Tacoma, no problem. It works well, does what it's supposed to do. I love warming my car up before I get to it when I get off work at 3am.
customer_reviews.author: o

customer_reviews.title: Finally got in stalled and was not easy thought i would buy one because of price
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again . Finally got in stalled and was not easy thought i would buy one because of price. No instructions with it. Had to call a stereo store and they said they would install it for 200 . Not what i wanted to do. No customer service .
customer_reviews.author: renea

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Cost $250 to get it installed in my moms 2010 Honda Civic. She loves it for the cold NE winters! Only didn't work a few times when it drops below 0° outside.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Only for the knowledgeable:)
customer_reviews.text: Way too hard to install. Ugh! Great if your a electrician or car guy/girl.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Let's start your engines
customer_reviews.text: Nice use this to upgrade and also what a bargain
customer_reviews.author: Playkash

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: After some confusion I had to return this item. It wouldn't work for my car without further upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: DIANNE BEYER

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and she loves it. We had some cold weather and snow and she loves the fact that her car is warm without her leaving her house. A Trick that somebody had told me. If you push the remote against your chin it will give another 500 feet because our body works like an antenna. I tried it and it does
customer_reviews.author: mourad

customer_reviews.title: Best budget remote start system on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these and installing them for years. Top shelf stuff, here. However, you will need complete wiring diagrams for your vehicle, along with some heavy automotive electrical experience to get the job done cleanly and correctly. Don't bother with the places that install these for $99, or whatever....I have removed far too many of those due to the poor installations. Getting it done the right way will run $250-$350 for the labor, but may save you the heartache of your car not starting at all down the road.
customer_reviews.author: William R.

customer_reviews.title: Great item - needed professional installation
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price. Very little installation instructions included with the product. I needed a professional install. If you have never installed a car starter, you will need assistance! Also, this may seem elementary but ensure you car already has an electric trunk lock before purchasing a starter with the trunk unlock button option. Starter options only work with pre-existing car options.
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN  AYERS

customer_reviews.title: Line up an installer first ...
customer_reviews.text: Good luck finding anyone to install it... nobody will touch this due to liability. You would be better off paying a bit more at a shop and have them install.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Poor tech support
customer_reviews.text: Expected to find a support database with wiring diagrams, schematics etc. Found that was available only to registered installers. Also not all features are accessible unless you have a programmer. Thankfully other manufacturers had info available. They will get my business next time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Machuski

customer_reviews.title: Avital FTW
customer_reviews.text: Love DEI products, have been using for years! Installed in a 1997 Buick LeSabre and worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product instillation not for novices
customer_reviews.text: this starter is great and on par with many more expensive models. it has many programable features, but be warned the instillation should only be done by a professional--in all fairness it does say it in the instructions. It took my friend who owns a mechanic shop 2 hours to install and set up all the programing
customer_reviews.author: Robert Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: OK...READ FINE PRINT
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE NICE UNITS, BUT REQUIRE A LOT OF "IN THE MIDDLE" ELECTRONICS. SUCH AS BYPASS AND OVERRIDE BOXES. WHEN YOU BUY THOSE, YOU STILL NEED HELP>>> NOT A DO IT YOURSELF.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: great price. I was having difficulty finding replacement remotes ...
customer_reviews.text: great price. I was having difficulty finding replacement remotes so I ordered the complete kit. Which plugged right into my old connections. after connecting the new brain I found that the 2 remotes were already programmed to the brain.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Q.

customer_reviews.text: This product seems like it will do exactly what I want - but the installation instructions are just not there. The manufacture has a web site with the right installation information, but they limit access to dealers. I wish the on-line dealers would provide a link to the Directed Electronics Knowledge-base website. That would make this product much more valuable to the DIY installer.

This product will not let you down.

product_meta.title: Avital 4103LX Remote Start System with Two 4-Button Remote
product_meta.description: Size:4-buttonPerforms lock and unlock tasks Without physical contact with the vehicle. Power Door locks can be controlled from several feet away or even within a building using a remote FOB. The FOB emits a radio Frequency that is digitally encoded to prevent Frequency stealing so No one can enter into your vehicle Without your wireless transmitter. Allows a vehicles engine to activate Without physical contact from the user. This feature is useful for warming up your vehicles engine and transmission to operational temperatures. In cold climates you can have your interior Hot or in warm climates you can cool it down before use. All of this can be done while in the comfort of your home or office. This unit comes with Trunk release capability and remote control integration for OEM alarm or add-on Trunk release systems. POP your Trunk using your remote transmitter for convenience and ease of use. Carrying a handful of groceries? arms tied up with Luggage? pop the Trunk Without using your key so it’s open and waiting for you when you arrive.
feature_bullets: This unit requires a BYPASS Module for installation
Panic mode will sound alarm (optional) and flash your parking lights
Valet mode will not arm the security system with the remote transmitter / Valet take-over allows the vehicle to remain running after the key has been removed from the vehicle
Remote start feature allows you to remotely start and run your vehicle for a period of time
For most 2007 or newer vehicles additional accessories will be required
The manufacturer only provides technical support to authorized dealers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars787 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
